titleStmt.title: Aquamusæ: or, Cacafogo, cacadæmon, Captain George Wither wrung in the withers. Being a short lashing satyre, wherein the juggling rebell is compendiously finely firked and jerked, for his late railing pamphlet against the King and state, called Campo-musæ. By John Taylor.
titleStmt.author: Taylor, John, 1580-1653.

publicationStmt.date: Printed in the fourth yeare of the grand rebellion. [1645]

notesStmt.note: Place of publication suggested by Madan.
Printed by L. Lichfield. Cf. Madan.
Reproduction of the original in the the British Library.
